FIS¶

class FIS(groupset: Union[str, hotfis.membership.fuzzygroupset.FuzzyGroupset], ruleset: Union[str, hotfis.rules.fuzzyruleset.FuzzyRuleset])¶

Bases: object

Fuzzy inference system (FIS).

A FIS is comprised of a FuzzyGroupset containing membership functions and a FuzzyRuleset containing rules referring to said membership functions.

With compatible membership functions and rules, a FIS is capable of determining memberships, fuzzified Mamdani output, and defuzzified Takagi-Sugeno-Kang (TSK) output.

The FIS class also includes methods for defuzzifying Mamdani output, plotting Mamdani/TSK output, converting calculated memberships to Mamdani/TSK output, and other utilities.

Parameters

  • groupset – Groupset of membership functions or path to file with groups.

  • ruleset – Ruleset to be evaluated or path to file with rules.

groupset¶

Groupset of membership functions required for evaluation.

Type

FuzzyGroupset

ruleset¶

Ruleset to be evaluated.

Type

FuzzyRuleset

Example

Method 1:

>>> fis1 = FIS(
>>>     # Create membership functions
>>>     FuzzyGroupset([
>>>         # Create temperature group for input
>>>         FuzzyGroup("temperature", 30, 70, [
>>>             FuzzyFunc("cold", [30, 40], "leftedge"),
>>>             FuzzyFunc("warm", [30, 40, 60, 70], "trapezoidal"),
>>>             FuzzyFunc("hot", [60, 70], "rightedge")
>>>         ]),
>>>
>>>         # Create heater group for output
>>>         FuzzyGroup("heater", 0.0, 1.0, [
>>>             FuzzyFunc("off", [0.1, 0.2], "leftedge"),
>>>             FuzzyFunc("medium", [0.1, 0.2, 0.8, 0.9], "trapezoidal"),
>>>             FuzzyFunc("on", [0.8, 0.9], "rightedge")
>>>         ]),
>>>     ]),
>>>
>>>     # Create ruleset
>>>     FuzzyRuleset([
>>>         "if temperature is cold then heater is on",
>>>         "if temperature is warm then heater is medium",
>>>         "if temperature is hot then heater is off",
>>>     ])
>>> )

Method 2:

=== example_groups.txt ===

group temperature
leftedge cold 30 40
trapezoidal warm 30 40 60 70
rightedge hot 60 70
domain 30 70

group heater
leftedge off 0.1 0.2
trapezoidal medium 0.1 0.2 0.8 0.9
rightedge on 0.8 0.9
domain 0.0 1.0

=== example_rules.txt ===

if service is poor or food is rancid then tip is cheap
if service is good then tip is average
if service is excellent and food is delicioius then tip is generous

>>> fis2 = FIS(
>>>     "example_groups.txt",
>>>     "example_rules.txt",
>>> )

Methods

approximate_mamdani()

Creates FIS with output functions approximated through TSK evaluation.

convert_to_mamdani(memberships[, num_points])

Converts membership values to fuzzified Mamdani output.

convert_to_tsk(memberships)

Converts membership values to defuzzified Takagi-Sugeno output.

defuzz_mamdani(domain, codomain)

Defuzzifies Mamdani output and returns scalar value(s).

eval_mamdani(x[, num_points])

Evaluates input and returns fuzzified Mamdani output.

eval_membership(x)

Given input, evaluates memberships to all output functions.

eval_tsk(x)

Evaluates input and returns de-fuzzified Takagi Sugeno Kang output.

plot_mamdani(domain, codomain)

Plots output of Mamdani inference.

plot_tsk(tsk_output)

Plots output of Takagi-Sugeno-Kang inference as a vertical line.
approximate_mamdani() → hotfis.fis.fis.FIS¶

Creates FIS with output functions approximated through TSK evaluation.

EXPERIMENTAL

Returns

A new FIS with approximated Mamdani output functions.

convert_to_mamdani(memberships: Dict[str, Dict[str, ArrayLike]], num_points: int = 100) → Dict[str, Tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray]]¶

Converts membership values to fuzzified Mamdani output.

Parameters

  • memberships – Dictionary with output group names as keys and values that are dictionaries. These have membership function names as keys and memberships as values.

  • num_points – Number of points to evaluate when building output.

Returns

Dictionary with output group names as keys and values that are dictionaries with membership function names as keys and an array with arrays of memberships as for each input value.

convert_to_tsk(memberships: Dict[str, Dict[str, float]]) → Dict[str, float]¶

Converts membership values to defuzzified Takagi-Sugeno output.

Parameters

memberships – Dictionary with output group names as keys and values that are dictionaries. These have membership function names as keys and memberships as values.

Returns

Dictionary with output group names as keys and memberships as values.

static defuzz_mamdani(domain: numpy.ndarray, codomain: numpy.ndarray) → ArrayLike¶

Defuzzifies Mamdani output and returns scalar value(s).

Parameters

  • domain – Domain of Mamdani output.

  • codomain – Output memberships corresponding to domain.

Returns

Defuzzified output(s).

eval_mamdani(x: Mapping[str, ArrayLike], num_points: int = 100) → Dict[str, Tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray]]¶

Evaluates input and returns fuzzified Mamdani output.

Parameters

  • x – Input values as dictionary with input groups names as keys and a scalar or array-like as values. Also supports other data structures similarly accessible by input group name.

  • num_points – Number of points to evaluate when building output.

Returns

Dictionary with output group names as keys and values that are tuples with two arrays. The first array is the domain of the membership function. The second is a corresponding codomain value for each input value. See the defuzz_mamdani method for converting a domain and codomain(s) into scalar inputs.

eval_membership(x: Mapping[str, ArrayLike]) → Dict[str, Dict[str, ArrayLike]]¶

Given input, evaluates memberships to all output functions.

Parameters

x – Input values as dictionary with input groups names as keys and a scalar or array-like as values. Also supports other data structures similarly accessible by input group name.

Returns

Dictionary with output group names as keys and values that are dictionaries. These have membership function names as keys and memberships as values.

Example

>>> fis = FIS("example_groups.txt", "example_rules.txt")
>>> memberships = fis.eval_membership({
>>>     "temperature": [32, 56, 77, 55, 33, 21, 90]
>>> })
eval_tsk(x: Mapping[str, ArrayLike]) → Dict[str, ArrayLike]¶

Evaluates input and returns de-fuzzified Takagi Sugeno Kang output.

Parameters

x – Input values as dictionary with input groups names as keys and a scalar or array-like as values. Also supports other data structures similarly accessible by input group name.

Returns

Dictionary with output group names as keys and de-fuzzified outputs for each input.

static plot_mamdani(domain: numpy.ndarray, codomain: numpy.ndarray)¶

Plots output of Mamdani inference.

Can be used in conjunction with an output membership function group’s plot method to visualize both the group and inference output.

Parameters

  • domain – Domain values of output as returned by Mamdani eval.

  • codomain – Output membership values as returned by Mamdani eval.

static plot_tsk(tsk_output: float)¶

Plots output of Takagi-Sugeno-Kang inference as a vertical line.

Can be used in conjunction with an output membership function group’s plot method to visualize both the group and inference output.

Parameters

tsk_output – Single TSK output value.
